page.title: 15CHILLENDEN,BLACKSMITH SHOP
page.content: The forge in Chillenden is owned by Mr. Donald Hogston. He makes his own horse shoes out of twenty foot lengths of concave mild steel bars. He can make up to twenty shoes from one bar. He uses stainless steel nails. The blacksmith makes shoes for riding schools and business people, who own horses up to twenty miles away. It costs Â£16 to shoe a horse, plus extra money for studs and pads. The blacksmith also supplies aluminium plates for race horses. He works five and a half days a week and shoes about 24 horses in that time. He has an all night burner to keep his furnace going. He is very happy in his work and with life in the small village of Chillenden.
